NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Waste Management and Investment or the cell corresponding to Exploration and Technology?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Exploration} and {Technology} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Exploration and Investment or the cell corresponding to Distribution and Prices?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Distribution} and {Prices} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Renewables and Storage or the cell corresponding to Coal and Technology?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Coal} and {Technology} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Coal and Prices or the cell corresponding to Electricity and Production?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Electricity} and {Production} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.63 to 0.73?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Coal, Storage), (Distribution, Storage), (Electricity, Storage), (Oil, Storage), (Renewables, Storage), (Transmission, Storage), (Waste Management, Storage), (Water, Storage)}.
